items.title: 苹果内部讨论是否竞购Perplexity AI (原标题: Apple Internally Discussing Whether to Bid to Acquire Perplexity AI)
items.creator: Eric Slivka
items.summary:
## 苹果考虑收购AI搜索引擎Perplexity AI

根据彭博社马克·古尔曼的报道，苹果公司高管正在内部讨论收购领先的AI初创公司Perplexity AI的可能性。Perplexity以其AI驱动的网络搜索引擎而广受欢迎。

### 讨论现状与参与者

*   **参与高管**：苹果并购主管阿德里安·佩里卡（Adrian Perica）、服务主管埃迪·库（Eddy Cue）以及其他负责苹果AI工作的负责人均参与了讨论。
*   **讨论阶段**：古尔曼指出，这些讨论尚处于早期阶段，不一定会导致正式的收购要约。
*   **各方回应**：苹果公司对此拒绝置评。Perplexity则表示，其“对任何涉及Perplexity的当前或未来并购讨论一无所知”。

### 影响收购决定的关键因素

*   **谷歌反垄断审判**：苹果是否会竞购Perplexity，可能取决于正在进行的谷歌反垄断审判结果。苹果与谷歌的现有协议（使谷歌成为苹果设备的默认搜索引擎，每年为苹果带来约200亿美元收入）可能会因对谷歌不利的裁决而失效。若此情况发生，Perplexity对苹果的吸引力将大增。
*   **Perplexity估值**：Perplexity在最近一轮融资中估值达到140亿美元。如果苹果成功收购，这将无疑是这家库比蒂诺公司历史上最大的一笔交易，远超十多年前30亿美元收购Beats的纪录。

### 替代方案与潜在挑战

*   **合作可能性**：除了直接收购，苹果也可能选择与Perplexity合作，将其AI搜索功能整合到Safari和Siri中。据报道，两家公司近几个月已多次会面，讨论Perplexity的技术。
*   **三星交易**：然而，Perplexity据称正与三星（苹果最大的竞争对手）达成一项广泛协议，旨在将其AI功能引入三星手机。这一举动可能会使苹果的任何潜在交易复杂化。

![perplexity ai mac](https://images.macrumors.com/t/j3in9EeJ3qt6RZLQ4yLRtHOETkU=/400x0/article-new/2024/10/perplexity-ai-mac.jpg?lossy)
items.shortSummary: 苹果公司正在内部讨论是否收购AI搜索引擎初创公司Perplexity AI。此次讨论尚处于早期阶段，可能不会形成正式报价。Perplexity最近估值达140亿美元，若收购成功将是苹果史上最大交易。谷歌反垄断审判结果可能影响苹果的搜索协议，从而增加Perplexity的吸引力。苹果也可能选择与Perplexity合作。然而，Perplexity与三星的潜在合作可能使苹果的计划复杂化。
items.translated_title: 苹果内部讨论是否竞购Perplexity AI
items.content:
Apple executives have been discussing the possibility of the company making a bid to acquire Perplexity AI, according to Bloomberg's Mark Gurman. Perplexity is one of the leading AI startups that has proven popular as an AI-infused web search engine.


Mergers and acquisitions chief Adrian Perica, services head Eddy Cue, and other executives overseeing Apple's AI efforts have been participating in the discussions, which Gurman says "are at an early stage and may not lead to an offer." Apple declined to comment, while Perplexity said that it has "no knowledge of any current or future M&A discussions involving Perplexity."

Whether or not Apple makes a bid for Perplexity may hinge on the outcome of the ongoing Google antitrust trial, as Apple's deal with the search engine giant to make Google the default search engine on Apple devices and which brings Apple roughly $20 billion per year could be nullified as part of a ruling against Google.

Perplexity's most recent funding round valued the company at $14 billion, so an outright acquisition by Apple would undoubtedly be by far the largest deal in the Cupertino company's history, topping its $3 billion purchase of Beats over a decade ago.

As an alternative to an acquisition, Apple could instead choose to partner with Perplexity to add its AI search capabilities to Safari and Siri, and the two companies have met multiple times in recent months to discuss Perplexity's technology. Perplexity is, however, said to be close to a far-reaching deal with Samsung to bringing its AI features to the phones of Apple's biggest rival, a move that could complicate any potential deal with Apple.
Tags: Mark Gurman, Perplexity

items.title: 股东起诉苹果公司，指控Siri功能延迟导致股价下跌 (原标题: Apple Sued by Shareholder Over Delayed Siri Features Allegedly Lowering Stock Price)
items.creator: Joe Rossignol
items.summary:
# 股东起诉苹果公司Siri功能延迟

股东Eric Tucker近日在加州法院对苹果公司提起了一项拟议的集体诉讼，指控其违反美国联邦证券法。该诉讼将苹果公司、首席执行官蒂姆·库克（Tim Cook）、前首席财务官卢卡·梅斯特里（Luca Maestri）以及现任首席财务官凯文·帕雷克（Kevan Parekh）列为被告，该案件仍需法官认证。

## 核心指控

诉讼的核心指控是，苹果公司在2024年全球开发者大会（WWDC 2024）主题演讲中预告的更个性化Siri版本方面做出了虚假陈述。原告声称，这些行为损害了公司的股价，进而损害了股东的利益。

具体指控包括：
*   在2024年WWDC发布时，苹果公司缺乏这些先进的基于AI的Siri功能的实际原型。
*   苹果公司没有合理的依据相信其能在iPhone 16产品周期内（如果能的话）交付其所宣传的产品。

## 证据与背景

诉讼引用了Daring Fireball网站上约翰·格鲁伯（John Gruber）的一篇文章，该文章将Siri功能描述为首次公布时的“概念视频”。此外，诉讼还提及了苹果公司从YouTube下架的由演员贝拉·拉姆齐（Bella Ramsey）主演的个性化Siri广告，并回顾了许多其他关于Siri功能延迟的已知事实。

此诉讼与此前针对苹果公司类似情况提起的集体诉讼非常相似，但本次诉讼是由股东提起，并侧重于证券法。

## Siri功能延迟时间线与影响

*   **最初预期：** 苹果公司在今年3月表示，预计将在“未来一年”内推出延迟的Siri功能。
*   **最新确认：** 苹果市场营销主管格雷格·乔斯维亚克（Greg Joswiak）在最近的一次采访中明确表示，“未来一年”指的是2026年。
*   **目标版本：** iOS 26.4很可能是目前Siri功能推出的目标版本。

在苹果公司披露Siri功能延迟后的一周内，其股价下跌了近13%。截至目前，苹果公司尚未对此诉讼发表评论。

![iOS 18 Siri Personal Context](https://images.macrumors.com/t/OhQowpC3cfUFOWbMsQGx4Ta2k74=/400x0/article-new/2025/03/iOS-18-Siri-Personal-Context.jpg?lossy)
items.shortSummary: 股东Eric Tucker对苹果公司及其高管提起集体诉讼，指控其在2024年WWDC上对延迟的AI版Siri功能做出虚假陈述，且当时缺乏功能原型。诉讼称，这些行为导致苹果股价下跌近13%，损害了股东利益。苹果市场营销主管表示，这些Siri功能预计将于2026年随iOS 26.4推出。苹果尚未对此诉讼置评。
items.translated_title: 股东起诉苹果公司，指控Siri功能延迟导致股价下跌
items.content:
Apple shareholder Eric Tucker today filed a proposed class action lawsuit against the company in a California court, over alleged violations of federal U.S. securities laws.


Apple's CEO Tim Cook, former CFO Luca Maestri, and current CFO Kevan Parekh are also named as defendants in the case, which still needs to be certified by a judge.

The complaint alleges that Apple made false statements related to the more personalized version of Siri that it previewed during its WWDC 2024 keynote. The complaint alleges that these actions hurt the company's stock price, and thereby harmed shareholders.

"Unbeknownst to investors, Apple lacked a functional prototype of these advanced AI-based Siri features at the time of the 2024 WWDC and had no reasonable basis to believe it could deliver the product it was advertising within the iPhone 16 product cycle, if ever," the lawsuit alleges. The complaint cites a Daring Fireball post by John Gruber that described the Siri features as being merely a "concept video" when they were first announced.

The complaint also mentions the personalized Siri ad starring actor Bella Ramsey that Apple pulled from YouTube, and recaps many other known facts about the delayed Siri features. The lawsuit is very similar to previous class action lawsuits filed against Apple over this situation, except this one is filed by a shareholder and is focused on securities laws.

In March, Apple said it anticipated rolling out the delayed Siri features "in the coming year" from that point. In a recent interview, Apple's marketing chief Greg Joswiak said that the "coming year" refers to 2026. iOS 26.4 is likely the current target for a rollout.

Apple's stock price dropped nearly 13% in the week after the company disclosed the delay.

Apple has yet to comment on the lawsuit.
Tags: Apple Intelligence, Apple Lawsuits, Siri

items.title: 苹果在欧盟iPhone和iPad页面添加能效和电池标签 (原标题: Apple Adds Energy and Battery Labels to iPhone and iPad Pages in EU)
items.creator: Joe Rossignol
items.summary:
# 苹果在欧盟iPhone和iPad页面添加能效和电池标签

为遵守今日生效的新法规，苹果已开始在欧盟国家的iPhone和iPad产品页面上添加能效标签，并要求在销售的设备中附带标签的印刷版本。

## 标签内容与评级
*   **能效等级**：标签根据欧盟的测试参数，将iPhone或iPad型号的能效等级从最高的A级到最低的G级进行评定。
*   **苹果的谨慎态度**：
    *   苹果表示，欧盟委员会概述的某些测试方法存在“模糊之处”。
    *   作为预防措施，苹果选择保守评分。例如，2025年6月在欧盟市场销售的iPhone型号在能效指数上均符合最高的“A”级，但苹果自愿将其降级为“B”级，以最大程度地降低第三方测试机构因不同解读法规而得出较低等级的可能性。
    *   出于同样原因，苹果也下调了“重复自由落体可靠性等级”的得分。
*   **其他信息**：标签还提供以下详细信息：
    *   每次完整充电周期的电池续航时间。
    *   可修复性等级。
    *   抗冲击性。
    *   防水防尘的防护等级（IP等级）。
    *   电池额定支持的完整充电周期次数。
    *   这些信息同样基于苹果对欧盟测试参数的解读。

## 标签的获取方式
*   **在线查看**：在苹果针对欧盟国家的本地化网站上，用户可以通过点击或轻触iPhone和iPad页面上的彩色小标签图标来查看。标签显示在所有在欧盟销售的iPhone和iPad型号的主要产品营销页面以及购买页面上。
*   **随附文件**：标签附带一份产品信息表（PDF），提供更全面的详细信息，例如：
    *   设备的电池容量（mAh）。
    *   基于莫氏硬度等级的屏幕抗刮擦性。
    *   安全更新的最低保证可用时间。

## 欧盟数据库
欧盟委员会的网站上有一个数据库，用户可以查看在欧盟销售的智能手机和平板电脑的能效标签信息。

## 适用国家
这些标签适用于以下欧盟国家：奥地利、比利时、保加利亚、克罗地亚、塞浦路斯、捷克共和国、丹麦、爱沙尼亚、芬兰、法国、德国、希腊、匈牙利、爱尔兰、意大利、拉脱维亚、立陶宛、卢森堡、马耳他、荷兰、波兰、葡萄牙、罗马尼亚、斯洛伐克、斯洛文尼亚、西班牙和瑞典。此外，挪威和瑞士也显示这些标签。

![Apple Adds Energy and Battery Labels to iPhone and iPad Pages in EU Feature](https://images.macrumors.com/t/FjHA-ytCnc00xmVoZWMGvu6vjLQ=/400x0/article-new/2025/06/Apple-Adds-Energy-and-Battery-Labels-to-iPhone-and-iPad-Pages-in-EU-Feature.jpg?lossy)
items.shortSummary: 苹果为遵守欧盟新规，已在欧盟地区iPhone和iPad产品页面及设备中添加能效和电池标签。这些标签根据欧盟测试参数，将能效等级从A到G评定，并包含电池寿命、可修复性等信息。尽管iPhone型号符合最高A级，苹果仍因测试方法模糊而自愿降级为B级，以确保一致性。用户可在苹果官网或设备中查看。

images.alt: Apple Adds Energy and Battery Labels to iPhone and iPad Pages in EU Feature

items.content:
To comply with a new regulation that takes effect today, Apple has added an energy efficiency label to its iPhone and iPad pages in EU countries. Apple is also required to start including a printed version of the label with the devices sold there.


The label grades a given iPhone or iPad model's energy efficiency from a high of A to a low of G, based on the EU's testing parameters. However, Apple said that certain aspects of the testing methods outlined by the European Commission are "ambiguous," so it chose to be conservative with its scores until testing is standardized.

In a 44-page document detailing its testing methodology for the labels, Apple said its current iPhone models qualified for the highest energy efficiency grade of A, but the company voluntarily downgraded these scores to a B as a cautionary measure:
As an additional cautionary measure, Apple went one step further and downgraded some of its scores to factor in test method ambiguities and variance. For example, Energy Efficiency Index scores for iPhone models on the EU market in June 2025 all qualified for the highest "A" grade, but Apple chose to voluntarily derate scores to a "B" grade to minimize the probability that a third-party tester interpreting the regulation differently would achieve a lower grade. We also downgraded scores for the Repeated Free Fall Reliability Class for the same reason.
The label also provides details about a given iPhone or iPad model's battery life per full charge cycle, repairability grade, impact resistance, ingress protection rating for water and dust resistance, and how many full charge cycles the battery is rated for. Likewise, this information is based on Apple's interpretation of the EU's testing parameters.

On the web, the label can be viewed by clicking or tapping on the colorful little tag icon on various iPhone and iPad pages on Apple's localized websites for EU countries. It is shown on both Apple's main product marketing pages for all iPhone and iPad models that are currently sold in the EU, and on the purchase page for those devices.

The label is accompanied by a product information sheet (PDF) that provides a comprehensive overview of even more details, such as the device's battery capacity in mAh, screen scratch resistance based on the Mohs hardness scale, the minimum guaranteed timeframe for availability of security updates, and much more.

On the European Commission's website, there is a database that lets you view energy label information for smartphones and tablets sold in the EU.

More details about the label are available on the European Commission's website.

EU countries include Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, the Netherlands, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, and Sweden. The labels are also shown in Norway and Switzerland.

For this week's giveaway, we've teamed up with Lululook to offer MacRumors readers a chance to win an iPhone 16 Pro and a Lululook Find My Tracker Card to go along with it.


Lululook's Tracker Card works like an AirTag, integrating with the Find My app on your iPhone. It's as thin as two credit cards so it can fit right into a wallet or passport, but it also has an optional lanyard on it so you can use it anywhere else.

Priced at $23, the tracker's battery lasts for up to five months and it can be recharged using a Qi-based wireless charger or a MagSafe charger. All of the ‌Find My‌ features are supported, so you can get notifications when you leave your wallet behind, view the last known location on a map, and play a sound if it's nearby. It's able to leverage the ‌Find My‌ network, relying on other nearby iPhones for tracking if you're out of Bluetooth range.

Lululook makes a range of accessories for iPhones, and if you need something to charge the Tracker Card, your ‌iPhone‌, and other devices, Lululook has some affordable 3-in-1 charging options with Qi2, which offers up to 15W wireless charging. Qi2 is equivalent to ‌MagSafe‌, and it features the same magnetic connection.

The $70 Lululook Qi2 3-in-1 Desk Charging Station comes in colors to match Apple's iPhones. It features an upright Qi2 charging platform for the ‌iPhone‌, an Apple Watch charger at the back, and an AirPods charging platform at the base. It's super compact and won't take up too much space on a desk.


Lululook's 3-in-1 Travel Charger has multiple folding positions, and it can charge an ‌iPhone‌, Apple Watch, and AirPods. When not in use, it folds up into a small square and can be tucked inside the included carrying case. It can unfold into a full three-device charger that can lay flat on a table, or it can be used upright with support for StandBy.


Right now, there are 20 percent discounts on both of these products when purchasing through Amazon, which drops the price even lower.

items.title: MacRumors 节目：WWDC 2025 传闻——哪些是对的，哪些是错的？ (原标题: The MacRumors Show: WWDC 2025 Rumors—What Was Right and Wrong?)
items.creator: Hartley Charlton
items.summary:
## WWDC 2025 传闻回顾：预测的准确性分析

本期 MacRumors 节目深入回顾了 WWDC 2025 之前流传的一些主要传闻，并评估了哪些预测最终被证实准确，哪些则未能实现。

### 未实现的传闻

*   **iPhone 上的 Stage Manager：** WWDC 2025 前最令人惊讶的说法之一是 iOS 26 会为配备 USB-C 端口的 iPhone 带来 Stage Manager 功能。然而，苹果并未宣布任何此类功能。这一想法可能源于人们对苹果将专业功能引入更多设备的普遍期望，但这一预测最终被证明完全失准。
*   **homeOS 平台：** 另一个未能实现的传闻涉及长期以来被提及的 homeOS 平台。一系列商标申请曾暗示苹果可能会推出一个新的智能家居操作系统。尽管这些商标申请是真实的，并且可能与未来的产品相关，但在 WWDC 2025 上并未提及任何类似 homeOS 或新的智能家居中心。这提醒我们，商标活动并不总是与发布时间表一致。

### 部分准确的传闻

有些报道介于完全正确和完全错误之间：

*   **Jon Prosser (Front Page Tech)：** 他的视频在很大程度上是准确的。他正确揭示了 iOS 26 的许多“Liquid Design”变化，例如浮动标签栏和更广泛的半透明界面。然而，他关于应用程序图标将变为圆形的说法并不正确。
*   **“Majin Bu”：** 这位爆料者准确预测了 iPadOS 26 将采用 Mac 风格的屏幕顶部菜单栏——这一改变确实出现了。但该爆料者关于此菜单栏仅在使用妙控键盘时才会出现的建议并未被证实。

### 准确的传闻

*   **9to5Mac 的预测：** 他们的报道，例如 Messages 应用将增加投票功能，以及锁定屏幕上的音乐将支持全屏专辑封面模式，都被证实是正确的。
*   **Mark Gurman (彭博社) 的报道：** 在 WWDC 2025 之前，他的报道全面且绝大多数准确。他正确揭示了 iOS 26、iPadOS 26 和 macOS 26 的新命名约定，以及“Liquid Glass”美学等重大设计变化。他还准确报道了 iPadOS 的 Mac 风格增强功能、电话和信息功能的扩展，以及 iOS 26 上新版原生应用（如“游戏”和“预览”）的到来。甚至电话和短信的实时翻译等高级功能也包含在他的会前报道中。

### 总结

事后看来，WWDC 2025 对于苹果传闻而言是丰收的一年，特别是来自信誉良好来源的传闻。但这也提醒我们，并非所有预测——无论其来源多么可靠——都能最终出现在苹果的主题演讲舞台上。

### MacRumors 节目信息

MacRumors 节目拥有自己的 YouTube 频道，听众可以通过订阅来获取新剧集和片段。此外，节目还可在 Apple Podcasts、Spotify、Overcast 或您偏好的播客应用上收听，也可以直接复制 RSS 源到播客播放器中。节目鼓励听众评分和评论，并提出未来希望看到的主题和嘉宾建议。节目曾邀请过众多知名嘉宾，包括 Kevin Nether、John Gruber、Mark Gurman、Jon Prosser 等。
items.shortSummary: 本期 MacRumors 节目回顾了 WWDC 2025 的传闻准确性。一些预测失准，如 iPhone 上的 Stage Manager 和 homeOS。部分传闻则喜忧参半，例如 iOS 26 的“Liquid Design”和 iPadOS 的菜单栏。彭博社的 Mark Gurman 报道最为准确，涵盖了新命名、设计和功能。总体而言，WWDC 2025 是传闻准确性较高的一年，但也再次提醒人们并非所有预测都会实现。
items.translated_title: MacRumors 节目：WWDC 2025 传闻——哪些是对的，哪些是错的？
items.content:
On this week's episode of The MacRumors Show, we take a rumor report card-style look back at some of the biggest rumors surrounding WWDC 2025, what was predicted correctly, and what missed the mark.

Subscribe to The MacRumors Show YouTube channel for more videos


One of the more surprising claims ahead of WWDC 2025 was the idea that iOS 26 would bring Stage Manager to iPhones with a USB-C port. No such feature was announced. The idea may have stemmed from broader expectations about Apple bringing pro features to more devices—but this prediction turned out to be entirely off-base.

Another rumor that didn't pan out involved the long-rumored homeOS platform. A wave of trademark filings hinted Apple might introduce a new smart home operating system. Although the filings were real and still might relate to future products, nothing resembling homeOS or a new smart home hub was mentioned at WWDC 2025. It's a good reminder that trademark activity doesn't always align with event timelines.

A few reports landed somewhere in the middle. Jon Prosser's Front Page Tech videos were largely accurate—he correctly revealed many of the iOS 26 Liquid Design changes, such as the floating tab bar and a broader translucent interface. However, his claim that app icons would become circular wasn't correct.

Similarly, the leaker known as "Majin Bu" made an accurate call about iPadOS 26 adopting a Mac-like menu bar at the top of the screen—a change that did appear. But the leaker's suggestion that this menu bar would only show up when using a Magic Keyboard didn't turn out to be true. Some reports, such as 9to5Mac's predictions that the Messages app would gain polls and a full-screen album artwork mode for music on the Lock Screen, were also correct.

Bloomberg reporter Mark Gurman's reporting ahead of WWDC 2025 was comprehensive and overwhelmingly accurate. He revealed the new naming convention for ‌iOS 26‌, ‌iPadOS 26‌, and macOS 26, as well as major design changes like the Liquid Glass aesthetic. He also nailed reports on Mac-like enhancements to iPadOS, expanded Phone and Messages features, and the arrival of new stock apps like Games and Preview on ‌iOS 26‌. Even advanced capabilities like live translation of calls and texts were part of his pre-event reporting.

In hindsight, WWDC 2025 was a good year for Apple rumors, especially from reputable sources. But it was also a reminder that not every prediction—no matter how well-sourced—makes it onto Apple's keynote stage.
